page.title: 08HAXBY AMBULANCE STATION
page.content: In an ambulance station there is a lot of equipment including:- stretcher bed roll, pillows, covers, sheets etc. The covers are folded so that when you pull them you can fold them up like a cocoon to keep the people warm. Ambulance men are not allowed to give injections unless there is a doctor. In the ambulance there are :- oxygen masks, gas, a large resuscitator with lots of equipment and also a hand resuscitator. 10 people work at the station from 7am. to 10pm.However from September 1985 it will be manned 24 hours a day. It covers an area including : Easingwold,Malton, Warthill,Haxby and all surrounding villages. They answer at least 3 emergency calls a day as well as transporting people to hospital for appointments.
